ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Such a fun class! Great into to women and children's health. Loved the discussion.
3 hours depending on papers and amount of reading.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the topics covered, but I think the class would benefit from some more contemporary articles to read.
It was a really good overview of women's health in the United States. Loved all the topics!
I thought that this was a great course. It provided an overview of mother and child health issues as well as the policies that have grown around them.
Interesting course, especially for someone like me who doesn't know that much about health policy.
Course is well organized, although the syllabus is not always up to date (some dates are from past years).

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Instructor was very knowledgeable and passionate about the topics discussed. I looked forward to her class.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Very helpful and really liked how she incorporated her life experiences into the lectures!
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Great lectures

Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Prof. Lee was a great instructor. She brought stories of her own work experience into the discussion which really helped to add to the material and make it more personal. She also allowed us to pick our own topics for papers which made it easy to focus our work in areas of interest.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Great professor who seems passionate about the topic at hand.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Mary Alice is good at engaging students in the discussion and providing feedback.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course. This course is an overview of the many components that affect the health of women and children in the United States. You also do a project where you learn about the maternal and child health systems of other developed nations and compare it to what you've learned in the course. I learned a lot about health insurance mechanisms in the US.
This is a great overview course that provides information on mother and child health issues as well as government response. I think it is relevant to many students and would highly recommend it.

Substantial information on Medicaid in this class. Fairly easy and straightforward. Great intro to the maternal and child health related policies in the U.S., and also some information on other countries' health care policies. Mainly lecture-based, with some discussion.
